TopicTitle: Tryin to build aweome but tryin 2 avoid the lag monster

Articles.Content:
howdy hooooo fellow space pilots!So i am stuck between a rock and a hard place and need some help figuring it out.So Below is my third station around mun.Why 3rd you ask?Because the other two are to big/lagg to much to try to even get within 2.5k of them.So i set of to build an awesome looking and efficient station that doesn't create a lagg monster when trying to dock or approach it.As you can see its not even complete,it only has a hab module ,keth tanks, and docking rack along the bottom, i still need to add atleast one keth converter with liquid fuel tanks attached, but im already approaching 400 parts.AT this point i think my only options are to stop building until optimization in hopes it reduces lag on somewhat "bigger" builds. Or add the two liquid fuel tanks laggin to crap.So that's why i am here to get ideas from the awesome community genius "design" engineers !Or anyone for that matter that could possibly help me with this predicament! Thanks a bunch~the dude abides.

so above is the hab module and keth tanks u can see clearly, i want to put the converters and liquid fuel tanks vertically in the same area as the kethtanks.And on the oppisite side i can see some of the ports is the docking rack

I actually created a bunch of pieces that are large and have simplistic colliders. This leads to little to no lag while still allowing you to have a lot of resources in orbit.

You can try my parts by clicking here: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/sizedd-part-pack-0-1/

I must warn you though that they arnt uber looking or anything like that. But they get the job done. The screenshots on that page gave me a very small amount of lag. If you try the parts out then I hope it helps. If you dont then okie dokie lol. (btw ima use your screenshot for my next station part lol)
For sure ,i'll take a look.And i have more pics different angles if you'd like too.I'd like to add to this instead of building a fourth base around MUN,atleast for now.
